intro: Carthamus ilicifolius, commonly known as the thorned safflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slight waxy coating. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
